title: Oh, There Will Be Blood And I Will Enjoy It All..
review:
Saw II is the sequel to the newest horror franchise to blow away our minds. You can without a doubt throw Saw II into the very small pile of films of sequels that are just as good or maybe even better than the original. From the oh-so-gross mind games Jigsaw plays to the twist and turns of the plot, Saw II is a must-see film for all the horror fans.

As you know, the plot involves a bunch of people thrown into a house where they are breathing in a deadly nerve gas. However, the plot gets very interesting after everything is laid out for you. Although some parts are could've been predicted, that didn't take away anything from the movie experience.

I can officially say that Jigsaw is one of the greatest serial killers in movie history, maybe even the greatest and topping Freddy. Jigsaw's technique of killing someone in such devastating manners without even touching them still stands fresh with some more added unique ways. There is no way you'll leave the theatre feeling something was missing. The game gets much more intriguing as the traps get more sickening.

Let's be honest, the acting will never be superb in a horror movie. I think there is an unwritten law that states that it is illegal to have good acting in a horror movie. With that said, the acting wasn't that bad. The cast did a wonderful job not giving us the dreaded teen-like performances (although there were only 2, maybe 3 teens). The director (Darren Lynn Bousman) did a wonderful job to showing scenes from the original to make connections between both films, which really made the sequel play out better.

Twists and turns, traps and games, and blood and death, what else could you ask for? Saw II works in ever yway imaginable. During the finally moments, I was on the edge of my seat, and when it was all said and done, I smiled and left the theatre with a very satisfied feeling. How much blood would you shed to see this movie? You better say a lot, because it was definitely worth it.

Grade: A

title: I thought it was impossible, but it was better than the first.
review: Being a die-hard Saw fan, I was excited to go see the sequel, but I must admit I was anticipating disappointment. I was wrong. Saw 2 was, in many ways, better than the first. The situations were much more intense and frightening, (I, the brick wall that I am, watched several scenes through my fingers), the plot was thicker, more twisted, and although confusing was easier to follow than that of the first movie, and let us not forget the gore, gore, gore! Watching a man saw through his foot in the first movie was definitely gut wrenching, but there were several situations in Saw 2 that blew "He doesn't want us to cut through our chains.. he wants us to cut through our feet" right out of the water. Just thinking about a couple makes me cringe. If you have a weak stomach, it may just be too much for you.. and even if you're tough as nails like me, don't buy the large popcorn. You won't finish it. Saw 2 is a fantastic continuation of the first movie, and is deliciously horrifying from the moment the lights dim to when they come back on.

title: Achieves what so many other horror sequels have failed to do
review:
I didn't see SAW in the theatre. I rented it and watched it at home, and it gave me the chills. It was a refreshingly original horror concept and the low budget of the film only made it work that much better, instead of working against it. Needless to say, when I heard and saw the previews for SAW II, I knew that this time I would have to see it in the theatre. Anyone who has seen SCREAM, or enough horror movies, knows some of the universal rules of horror movies. For example, is there more at stake in SAW II? Oh yes. Instead of two guys chained to a wall in a desolate room (and yes, we do find out if those two survived their trials or not), we now have six people trapped in a house full of booby traps and slowly dying from a nerve gas which they must find the antidotes for. Is it scarier? Yes...but there's also a lot more focus on John "Jigsaw" and how and why he became the serial psycho that he is (which also makes him more human and less of a dark mystery), and this is all very fascinating, but on the other hand you see more of the outside world and so this takes away a little from the chilling sense of isolation from all that is sane and normal that made the first one such a cult hit. But don't get me wrong...SAW II is DEFINITELY worth seeing!! Saw II exceeds where other horror sequels have bombed, and in some cases (Boogeyman, Darkness Falls, Alone in the Dark)where even the first horror movie failed miserably thus killing any need for a sequel. If you have any doubts about whether or not to see this one, I say: doubt not. It IS effectively dark, creepy, bloody and disturbing and supplies once again a "Holy crap!" twist ending! ************WARNING: If you haven't seen SAW II yet, read no further****

Just like to add that I thought it was neat that the one survivor from SAW (Amanda) becomes John's apprentice (you had to figure that this being a sequel, John was going to either suffer or, more likely, die at some point in the movie, and a man like him doesn't just let his legacy die with him) and thus makes room for what could easily be a very creatively evil SAW III. I kept wondering, too, why Amanda and the kid were the only ones NOT dying from the toxic gas, spitting up blood and convulsing. I liked that the cop's son was so close to him all the time and yet he never even knew it. As one commenter said, the images stay with you long after the movie's over. Deliciously evil.

title: A great film with a fantastic twist ending
review:
This movie, while not as good as the first, was still a fantastically entertaining film and delivered a great amount of gore and terror that is visible in the first. The twist ending wraps everything together and if you pay very close attention, you can figure it out. Of course I won't reveal any of it but I will say if you liked the first, the second will be entertaining and provide a significant amount of horror.

One thing that most people will enjoy is the story. While it takes a bit to get going, it picks up and gathers momentum. Leigh Whannel has to be one of the most creative and talented writers in Hollywood and he's definitely an underrated one.

One last parting note...if you love horror with a story, this is one you will want to add to your collection when it comes out.

title: wow
review:
I saw this movie today with my sister. We both love horror movies and loved Saw I, so we were really excited for II to come out. I was surprised at how the movie started out, definitely got my attention. And kept it throughout the entire movie. I kept trying to figure out what was going on and who was up to what and all that throughout the thing, but I could never get it all together. The ending was GREAT. Completely unexpected. There are twists throughout the whole movie.

Warning to anyone wanting to see this movie: If you are even the tiniest bit squeamish, DO NOT go to see this movie. It's gory from beginning to end, no stop on the blood and blood and blood. It's much more gory than the first.

title: Surprisingly good sequel
review: I went to see Saw 2 assuming it would suck, but to my surprise it rocked. I didn't think that I would leave the film shocked or wanting more, but I did. While I was closing in on the end, I felt that it was going to be predictable, but my predictions were incorrect. It is a must see. Unfortunately, many horror sequels end in disappointment. This film rates with the few successful horror sequels. It definitely deserves to be rated with such "sequel" classics as Halloween, Friday the 13th, and Scream. Luckily for us, it was not as disappointing as Nightmare on Elm Street part 2. When you see this film you will not be disappointed.

title: This movie was freaking awesome.
review: I thought the first one was clever UNTIL I saw the second one. The first one pales in comparison. The simple fact that you get to see Jigsaw in the flesh, the real person and see his motives..well it was truly chilling. The ending was cool too but also kind of just a way to lead to Saw Three which I think might ruin the franchise. My advice-QUIT WHILE YOU ARE AHEAD....I Don't THINK IT COULD GET ANY BETTER...JUST DOWN FROM HERE. That being said, I hated the main character Eric. I didn't feel connected to him in any way. Beverly Mitchell was good at standing around and looking scared but her death was boringgggggggg. I was on the edge of my seat the entire time and I loved it. I will definitely see again.

title: A lot more better for a few reasons.......
review: I thought Saw 2 was a great action packed and wonderfully acted movie. It had a few connections with the first Saw which made it really cool. The acting in this one was a lot more better. No corny actors, it didn't have any famous people in it an I think thats one of the reasons why it was so good. The traps in this one were incredible also. It had a few twists which made it really good too. Basically this movie was great. I walked in there thinking the worst, but I was impressed. WARNING, IF YOU ARE UNDER 17 AND ARE NOT WITH A PARENT, IT IS A BITCH TO GET IN. I walked in, i had my friend by two tickets at two different booths, then before we walked in the movies, they had to check our ID's and of coarse I'm only 16, so i had to wait until the teacher of my school got to the movies and me and 20 others walked in behind him. Then before u walk in to the real movie, they still check your ticket stub and all that jazz. But all that pain and suffering was worth it. I highly suggest seeing it.

title: Put Saw II on the best sequel list. Amazing.
review:
I'm just going to keep this short and sweet. Saw II was the perfect sequel film. If you thought the Terminater 2 was considered the best sequel to a movie hands down, now it has a competitor, and you can't argue with that.

The first Saw was perfect to begin with, but this takes it a step further and into another world, a world of hurt, and a world of redemption. You have to feel for these people as they play these "games". I can't imagine how the writer thought of these perfect tortures, and watching them occur is even better.

Go watch this movie and love it. You can't hate it, it's just perfection. Just remember one word about it: TWIST. One of the most creative twists in a movie ever and I'm still stunned. Let's just say, next October I'm ready for Saw III!

title: Good movie, bad ending.
review:
While this movie lacks the considerable intellectual development of its predecessor, it was still entertaining and thought provoking. The acting was much more realistic and enjoyable than the original; however this movie gave new meaning to the words "gratuitious gore". Yes, there was blood... a lot of it.

While I liked most of the movie, I found the ending ridiculous and disappointing. It didn't shock me; rather, it was so out of the blue and confusing that I could hardly even accept it. Overall, the movie was of pretty good quality, but it by no means exceeded or even came close to that of Saw, and I got the sense that the directors were trying to outdo themselves with every turn, especially the supposed shock value of the shoddy ending. There was definitely a perfect set up for a prequel, though.

title: The rare sequel that is actually better than the original.
review: The rare sequel that is actually better than the original. We get to learn a little more about what drives Jigsaw to do the things he does and even how he chooses his victims. The killings were even more lurid and disturbing (I spent the first ten minutes just absolutely squirming in my chair) and Tobin Bell gives a beautifully understated performance as John/Jigsaw. My only real complaint was that for a man very near to dying of cancer, Jigsaw seems to have no problems when it comes to money to spend on his gruesome killing machines. There are plenty of red-herrings and the three (count 'em) three twists come at the end, they are even more effective than the unlikely twist of the first. Genre fans should rejoice that we have a new, smart horror franchise. For my full review of this and other recent movies, both in theaters and on DVD, please visit http://prosper761.blog-city.com

title: Brilliant, just brilliant
review:
I walked into the cinema this evening expecting a lot from this film. Given the success from the first film, I knew I was in for a good night.

In comparison to the first one, this one is slightly more predictable (in my opinion). I managed to predict that Daniels father was the one who'd arrested the former convicts in the house, I also managed to predict the whole 'pre-recorded' video stream. Although the twist with Amanda at the end had me struck, really good idea. Strangely all of this didn't affect my opinion on the film, I still walked out the cinema a happy man.

All in all, I enjoyed this movie more than I did the first. Whether they should make a new one or not... I don't know, maybe they should... maybe they shouldn't.

title: SAW II the best horror movie sequel
review:
The first Saw broke new ground on the horror movie franchise. The way it doesn't make you scared of the man behind the deaths but the surroundings of where you are. Jig Saw doesn't kill you, you killed yourself. Just play by the rules and you will survive.

This movie is thee best and yes thee best horror movie sequel i have ever seen. In the first ten min. you will see thee best kill i have ever seen but how it is done will make you want to say WTF! and or OMG hundreds of times. This entire movie is full on puzzle. If you want to figure it out listen and listen well. Just play the game and follow the rules.

There will be a sequel and the sequel will break more new ground. A first will happen in all long time, the first and only time it happen was in the first Jason movie and now it will happen again. A FEMALE KILLER. LET THE GAME BEGIN.

title: Wow
review:
This movie is amazing, you must see it now. One of the most intense movie I have ever seen hands down. I was shaking the entire way through. Gorier than all hell, frightening, tense, clever. It is as good as the first if not better. I still can't believe what I've just witnessed. If you enjoyed the first or were just neutral, do yourself a favor and see this movie. Wow is the only word that can describe this. Not a disappointment in the slightest.

All I will say is, is that the loose ends from the first are all taken care of...he he...and you never see the final twist coming.

And what a twist it is.

title: A great sequel - a rare thing
review:
This movie is awesome! Even if you don't like the genre, it would be hard to admit this movie is not a worthy sequel. This movie leaves an impression on me not unlike another of my favorites, Cube (thanks LGF!).

The ending caught be a little by surprise, and not many movies can do that to me. It also holds some of the goriest scenes I've seen. It also answers some of my questions left from the first movie, although if you're not looking for them, it won't be obvious.

I wish I could spoil the movie and talk about all the awesome things in it. But if you're reading this wondering if you should see it in theaters - RUN! Everyone in the theater was at the edge of their seats. You definitely will miss the atmosphere if you wait to watch it at home.

Only if you hated the first movie should you pass on this sequel - everyone else, enjoy it!

title: Rock!
review: This movie rocked my ass off! I loved the first movie and I was absolutely itching to see the second one. It blew me away--it was thisclose to being as good as the first (the only reason it wasn't didn't grab me as hard this time was that, having seen the first I was used to the atmosphere and the plot)! I had my doubts since James Wan wasn't directing again, but with Leigh Whannell still behind the scenes it still turned out awesome--shocking, scary, gruesome, tense, and really worth the movie admission. The twists were amazing, Shawnee Smith was great, and I left the theatre totally slack-jawed and wishing there were more. Bring on Saw III!

title: Oh yes, there was blood
review: Oh yes, there was blood. The second one was off the damn meat rack. Not only was it a freaky movie that got in your head but it actually had a moral. Very few movies today have an underlining story, especially horror flicks. This series has re-introduced the meaning to horror movies to the world. for 15 years the world has gone through a drought filled with crap. Finally it has ended. The best part is people don't have to understand what john is trying to get through to the people. They get the life scared out of them. literally and change their ways so they don't end up in a death mask. Life is hard for those who run the streets. But its not as hard as living a slow and painful death, and knowing your going to die.

title: The Wait is Over
review:
last year i went to go see "Saw" a horror movie that was the best that i have seen in a long time. now a year later i have just finished seeing "Saw 2" and i have to say, well done!. the sequel is on par with the original, the story is awesome, and the acting is just right. to-bin Bell who returns to play jigsaw is given more screen time and it helps the story move along. as for the people who were trapped in the house they were all o.k. i guess. i didn't like any of them except for the black guy. the ending is what makes everything come full circle, if you thought the ending for the first saw was unbelievable well then you have to see this one. last thing, a lot more blood in this one, and i mean a lot. oh yes there will be blood.

9 out of 10

title: Warning: Not for the squeamish (there really was blood!)
review:
It's going to be hard to talk about it without spoilers but I'll try to keep them as brief as I can.

The first thing I would have to say is it proved me wrong when I thought this film couldn't beat the original. I can imagine the first film being a cult classic in 20 years and I thought this would be like the 2nd Exorist or the 2nd Blair Witch films.

But surprisingly this film did actually beat the original by far.

A quick summary of the story would be that the film involves Jigsaw capturing 8 more victims. Keeping them locked in his house they have two hours to find a cure for a virus thats going through the air until it keeps them. On the other side it has a story like the first film where there are cops on the hunt for Jigsaw.

The film is not for the squeamish as it's gory.

The main thing that was wrong with it was mostly the ending, it did have a better twist than the first film yet it was a little confusing and took a while to figure it out. (By then the film had finished) This was mostly why it didn't get ten out of ten.

The great thing about it was that it was intense and exciting towards the end. And if you liked the first film this is well worth the look.

Gross but worth every penny 9/10 (was originally 8 but changed it but the star rating stayed on 8)

title: Good, but could have been better.
review:
I liked Saw and Saw II. But this movie lacked some of what the first had.

A)The beginning part with the death mask was cool and all, but it provided no background as to why that man is being forced to kill himself. If I knew why he was there it would have made much more sense.

B)How do you get a key into someones eye socket, w/o them knowing, and make it so they don't feel pain when they wake up? C)How do you get like 10 people into the same house, all on the same night, without anyone knowing? D)Acting could have been a bit better.

E)Traps were kind of far-fetched.

F)The ultimate one: How does a 20 year old girl, and a 80 year old weak cancer patient manage to build this house of destruction and doom? Better yet, how do they manage to get that big safe into it? What I did like about the movie though are the references to Saw I. I like when they first open that door and you vaguely remember seeing it although there was no light. But when the girl turns on the light you see everything, including the corpses of the two previous victims, and their severed legs and arms. But the end was bad, where she becomes JigSaw, quoting my friend, "Okay, so were back to square one now?"

title: WoW
review: Oh My God This movie kicks ass. I advise EVERYONE to go see it. So many plot twists and things you would never see coming. Like The scene where the 8 people are being held in, underneath it is the place where Dr. Gordon and Adam where being held. Also Jigsaw dies......didn't see it coming. In ways I feel sorry that he died that way. That all the spoilers I'm gonna give but I give this movie 10/10. This IS my new favorite movie beating out the original Saw. Thank you Leigh Whannell & James Wan!!!! Go see the damn movie you will NOT be disappointed. And it is worth the money. I will see it many more times in the movies and I will buy it on DVD

title: Jigsaw is back and worse than ever!
review: My friend's b-day was yesterday and for a party, we saw "Saw 2" the opening night. I was surprised, it was REALLY good. I am a fan of the original and have it on DVD and this i have to say was better than the original IMO. First off i'd like to say is that the movie is more graphic than the first one and way more intense, and just like is says "There will be blood." If you've never seen the original, than you should know that this isn't the type of horror movie where things pop up every 10 minutes, it's about solving one giant puzzle. It is also good to see the first original one before you see this one because there are some moments and times where you go "I remember that!!" and it makes the story a heck of a lot easier to understand if you see the original one. All in all I think this movie was a great sequel and, IMO, is better than the sequel.

title: Oh yes, there IS blood.
review:
I was expecting very little of this movie when I first heard of a sequel, but I must say, I was very impressed. When I first left the movie theater, I felt empty, I felt like something was missing, but the next day it hit me.

This movie is genius, from start to finish. The opening is one of the most disgusting and vile I have seen. This movie lacks character development, but not much is needed, you know what situation they are in.

We learn much about Jigsaw in this movie that we never knew, he has very in depth conversations in this sequel.

The blood and gore in this movie WILL have you squirming in your seat, I don't care who you are. This effects are second-to-none, and you feel the pain of the victims. You will not watch this movie without getting sick to your stomach.

The ending leaves some to be desired, which is the only reason it is not a perfect 10. IT IS a twist ending, but not the one that I would have liked and partially predictable. Nothing compares to the ending in the first Saw.

This movie is a very solid 9, and a MUST SEE for horror fans.

title: oh my god
review: that might have been the best scary movie i have ever seen!!! the plot was so good and it was very well written considering they started writing it after the first one came out a year ago!!!! i was so speechless at the end of the movie, all my-friend and i could do was stair at each other!!!i wasn't to go see it again!! i suggest you go and see it right away........ it was a little bit more bloody than the first, but it is still very psychological!!! the only bad part was the sexy Cary Elways wasn't in this one.....lol!!!!i give it ten out of ten because it was just that good.......it is still giving me shivers!! burr!!!lol

title: one of the best sequels in years
review:
Jigsaw is back with a bang

great, i am gaga over this movie, the plot is good and the suspense is ooomph. if you like saw, you'll adore this movie except for the characters, whom i felt could have been better.

but overall amazing experience and even more frightening than saw, if blood runs down fear waves over ur spine.

and can you believe it the whole movie was filmed in just 25 days, guys it is damn good.

awesome experience, i would actually like a saw 3(those who have seen the movie will know the reasons for it) anyway go and enjoy it.

title: Notbad at all
review: After enjoying the first film I sat down to watch this with some trepidation - Saw to me was a 'one off film' and I never thought about a sequel. Anyways, from the cringingly typical start the film does OK with some nice thrills and look away moments. The only thing that really disappointed me about this one was that, unlike the first, there were only a few traps and contraptions even though the story allowed for way more. A half decent performance by Donnie Wahlberg playing an out of sorts cop who is equally backed up by Dina Meyer as his one time partner. Obviously the 'star(s)'of the movie are the situations left for us by Jigsaw which, as said before, are fewer than one would of expected. All in all, enough to keep fans of the first film happy.

title: The Perfect Gory Sequel
review: just go and see this movie. if you loved the first one, this one will be awesome. i am a big fan of gore and blood and thats why i loved the first Saw. i thought this would be a bad movie because it has only been a year since the first one but boy was i wrong. Saw 2 had everything a great sequel should have. A lot more blood and gore. New and awesome puzzles. And yet another twisted ending. This is one of those movies that you will be talking about with your friends in the parking lot. The ending was such a surprise to me i was just awe inspired by that ending. I'm not gonna mention it because i don't want to ruin it for those who haven't seen it but it was real good. Just go and see it. But if you don't like blood and gore DO NOT see it. But i thought it was the perfect sequel.

title: Twisted Pictures and LGF deliver another work of genius!
review: I watched SAW II last night on the opening night and words were few and far between to explain what i had just witnessed. I was slightly nervous about if this could live up to the original but oh it has! And yes, there is blood as promised! This film is simply amazing and is possibly one of the best films i have seen this year. I am slowly becoming a huge fan of Twisted Pictures and Lions Gate Films and have decided it is there i wish to end up because what they have made so far is revolutionising the horror genre as we know it! Anyone who is old enough should get down to the cinema and watch Saw II because it is an experience you will never forget!

title: Ouch that must have hurt
review: trying to decide do I watch Saw 2 or another film, thinking back to Saw yes it was brilliant, is this going to be another rush job make em as fast as you can remake DAME WAS I WRONG! From start to finish this film has you gripped. Yes sometimes you know what is going to happen but 95% of the time you are on the edge. The twist at the end who would have expected it? Even now 24 hours later I can still see flash images of the film and remembering the story line. Yes it looked a bit like the cube but who cares about that any way its an old house with square rooms! this one has corridors in it. Well done to all who were involved with this major horror 10 out of 10 from me.

title: Much Better
review:
To say this movie was a marked improvement over the first is an understatement, I hated the 1st movie, I watched it 2x opening weekend to make sure I did not miss all the good stuff everyone was saying about it and apparently I did because it did nothing for me, now this movie was much better executed, the acting, direction, camera work, story, everything on the whole was better, there was some predictable parts in the movie of course but what movie doesn't have them, there were a few twists and turns that kept you on your toes and the only part that made me twitch was the Pit of Syrenges(sp?) i still have twinges just thinking about that.

I highly recommend SAW II and will definitely purchase it when the DVD comes out.

title: You'll love it or hate it
review:
There is two ways this film could go. Firstly it could be a stunner completely out do the first film in every way, or it could go the way of most horror type sequels, which is straight in the bin. The film starts off with yet another enclosed room and a single guy that has to try and get out before his life ends. This then leads a police officer onto the seen who for some reason the 'jigsaw killer' has an agenda. This leads to a game being played with the officer and a group of people trapped in a house filling with deadly nerve gas, one of which is his son and one of the others we have seen before. if you don't know who that is i wont say. Its not by the way any of the guys that were trapped in the last one, you do find out what happened to them. This i'm a little disappointed about, I preffered not knowing, i felt it more fun to make up your own mind on it.

The film in the most part is fairly average and was starting to head the way of most horror sequels until we hit the twist. Ahh the twist yes this for me turned an average film into a good film, yes it happens with about 5 minutes of the film left but it is strong enough to lift the film to the score i have given it. In my view the twist was better than the one in the last film and leaves it open for yet another sequel.

Better than the first film? Probably not, but then that was an original film, whereas with this we know what it is all about. Still it is worth a watch and does enough that we can probably expect saw to be a Halloween regular.

title: bloody nightmare
review: Don't bother bringing popcorn to this one, because it won't be long before you have no appetite. I really think the movie was well done, even though it freaked me out completely. If you were a big fan of Saw then you should feel right at home with saw 2. There are some huge twists in this movie, but you can watch them for yourselves. One scene that you may find disturbing is, well all of them. Jigsaw decides to give himself a big role in this one by Having the detective (whose son is being held captive)sit down and talk with him throughout the madness. His son, along with 7 others who are linked to his father by means of arrest are stuck in a s*$t hole house trying to find antidotes to save their own lives. This movie will have you on the edge of your seat the whole movie. Here's my bet to those who haven't seen it, I bet you can't watch the entire movie with out at least cringing or closing your eyes at least a couple times. =)

title: Very solid effort
review:
While there are so many terrible horror movies that are spewed out that follow ridiculous formulas and have no relevance to society, this one makes a decent effort to say something meaningful and be original in the process. Granted, it is still an effort at entertainment as much, and probably more so, as it is social commentary; also, it doesn't always come out perfectly (including some unintentionally humorous moments and some small things that didn't quite add right), and it's easy to argue that many of the conceptual traits can be found in other, more respected movies (i.e. Se7en). Overall, though, it came off considerably better than the first one. It almost seems that this movie was the "final draft" of sorts, with the first being the rough draft.

If you enjoyed the original Saw and can handle more gore than the first, this is worth seeing, if for nothing else than a great improvement in virtually all regards.

title: Seriously Disturbing!
review: After watching the first one, I went into the cinema to watch Saw II hoping to be as shocked, and that is exactly what happened. I was worried that they may ruin the first one by bringing out a sequel, as more often then not they are rubbish. However Saw II completely surprised me, it was not only far more gory then the first one (think of the scene when he saws off his foot then times that by 100 and your pretty much there!) but the twists at the end are genius! What I also liked about this film is it cut out all the boring bits of when he kidnaps the wife and daughter, and is replaced by twisted scenes that make you feel very uncomfortable! If you're a big fan of Saw I, and even if your not you have to see this film but believe me this is not for the faint hearted, few bits where I had to cover my eyes! Jigsaw is back!

title: When in comparison with the original-BETTER
review: I was a fan of Saw last year. Even though similar plot lines have developed before (the superior se7en comes to mind), Saw still felt original and twisted enough to maintain my interest and when combined with an awesome ending- I was won over. Now it is a year later and the story of the Jigsaw killer continues. This movie is not some lame sequel, yet a worthy follow-up of its predecessor. The acting was far better in this movie. The gore was amped up. And above all else, Saw II managed to maintain a feel of obscure discomfort and unease while watching. I had my doubts at first, but after seeing it , I am very glad this sequel was made. If the quality (by quality i mean -good disturbing psychological thriller material) of these films can remain, then I would gladly welcome more sequels in this series. PS-don't let anyone ruin the ending for you!

title: In a word...WOW
review: Let me start off by saying that I really enjoyed Saw. Sure, the acting was a bit off at times and the twist ending took some suspension of disbelief to accept, but it was an original, engaging film. I was worried at first the the development team of Saw II was going to make some slip-ups because of their rush to release it before Halloween. Thank God that I was wrong. This movie was absolutely amazing. The acting was a huge leap upwards from that of its predecessor and the plot was even more intense, believe it or not, this time around. I didn't actually think that Saw II was that "gory", but the violence on hand was very graphic. It will take a hard stomached person to not squirm during the needle scene and the wrist-slashing trap. Tobin Bell turned in a great performance as Jigsaw and really added depth to the maniacal character. I also liked the inclusion of other original cast members. There were even a few scenes in the finale that act as great throwbacks to the original and serve to further connect the two movies. The end even had a few well developed twists and turns that were both logical and believable.The doors have been successfully opened to create at least one more sequel, and if it is even nearly as good as Saw II, which I think might even be better than the original , I will welcome it with open arms.

title: Opening night review
review: I have to admit that when I found out that there was going to be a sequel I convinced myself that it wasn't going to be as good as the original but I decided being Halloween weekend and all I had to give it a chance. The minds at Twisted Pictures really pulled through again. The plot and the writing behind it were amazing. Knowing that there were going to be plot twists I kept looking for them the whole time but still ended up being shocked in the end. I was literally on the edge of my seat the entire movie, it kept me thinking the whole way through. I am going to be anxiously awaiting the possibility of a SAW III. After weeks of anticipation I was not disappointed at all. I'd recommend to anyone that I knew could handle it.

title: Awesome, thrilling, intense....GO SEE IT NOW!!!
review: Usually sequels do not live up to their predecessor. This one surpassed the original by miles. The acting was so much better than the first. The 2 main characters in the first one just didn't seem to be into the movie until like the very end. That plot was way better. The director tied everything together between the first and the sequel very well. The surprises were even better. The movie rocked hardcore. If you haven't seen the first one, it isn't totally necessary to see it, but it would help explain a couple things. It's fun trying to guess what is going on. Once again, I was dead wrong. The ending of this movie is amazing!!!

title: We come for the depravity, we stay to connect the dots
review:
I saw the first 'Saw' film with a good friend of mine. She left in tears, crying all the way home.

Naturally, we had no choice but to set off for the second.

What really intrigued me before we even got into the theater was the active carding going on. Since when does this happen? I can't speak for the rest of the world, but I barely knew the concept even had merit in Montreal.

Naturally, I expected the gore to blow my mind.

Interestingly enough, it did not perform such an action. Mind you, this film is truly gruesome when it decides to be. One second you'll have generic paddlin' gore and then the next your eyeballs will feel violated and your skin will crawl for the poor fool on screen.

The gore isn't what matters here though. There's a lot going on in this film. I'd go so far as to say that its very machinations are superior to its prequel in every way, exempting the lack of a consistent "ick" factor and one very depressing aspect of the film...

The characters are horrible. There is no one to love in this film. Well, okay, the most likable character is Shawnee Smith (who returns from the first film to endure some more pain) but it's hard to pay attention to how good she is when everyone around her is attracting your eyes and ears with just how much you wish you were knocking their teeth out.

Oh yes, and Jigsaw is an extremely likable character despite being our featured antagonist.

What I intended to get at (before I decided to ramble) was just how fun it is after this movie, to piece everything together. While watching, certain things will seem foolish or flawed (and as I've told "plot pickers" of the first film, this would be false with one possible exception) but inevitably come together and before you have time to process it, something else will make sense and by the end of all this processing you've still got some thinking to do on the way home.

Awesome Tobin Bell, awesome Shawnee Smith, some lukewarm but welcome Dina Meyer and a whole lot of uncomfortable squirming every time someone is about to get punctured, prodded, sliced, diced or otherwise ripped to pieces by god knows what.

7/10 or 3 and 1/2 stars

title: Summarized in one word... BRILLIANT!
review: I never thought the makers would be able to top their amazing plot and story of the first Saw movie, but I was wrong. This movie was psychologically brilliant. The entire movie I found myself trying to think like John (Jigsaw). When the end came along (I won't ruin it, you have to see it for yourself, it's just that damn good!), I wasn't even close. Every aspect of shear brilliance was covered, with, of course, another amazing twist at the end. Best movie I've seen in a while. I hope the makers will keep it at this. It'll be very hard to get three in a row, but if they do, it will successfully be my favourite trilogy. If you haven't seen this yet, its the perfect date movie! Enjoy it to its fullest and embrace the magic of Saw. I know, its about killing and whatnot, but look beyond that and see the brilliance of the entire thing.

title: loved it
review: I love this movie because of what it's about. He puts these people through painful jigsaw puzzles and if they really want to live then they figure out what he's talking about and make it. He only picks people that really have no reason to live, drugys, bums, etc...If you did make it through and live then he would help you get you life back together. If everybody would just look at life as Jigsaw does then everybody would be so much happier. It's a great movie, my top 3. First is Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind and second is Saw, the first one. awesome! Pretty gruesome but a beautiful movie all in all. As long as you have a strong stomach, I recommend it.

title: Oh Yes, There was Blood
review:
A pretty well done follow up after Saw from a year ago. Although I think the first one was better the second one is more evil.

The thing I didn't like too much was the characters weren't put down thoroughly enough and that took a little away from the film compared to the last one. Also there is some things that went on in the film and then just dropped for the sake of what was really going on. You'll know what I mean when you/if you see it.

The ending didn't disappoint at all. Another twist that wouldn't be expected lives up to this series as twisted and psychotic. It does very well considering how I wondered how it was gonna follow up this time around. It played out very well to say the least other than some odd flow of the movie. But anyone in for a psychological thriller and any fans of the Saw series will enjoy.

title: incredible
review: this was the best movie ever.. i think twice as better as the original.. but no more because the first was incredible too.. seeing saw 2 was seriously an experience.. not a movie.. go watch it right now! this was the first movie where i actually called everyone in my phone book to tell them how great of a movie it was.. if you like the mind of jigsaw and his sick psychotic games.. this is definitely the movie for you.. I'm seriously buying another ticket and watching this movie again.. i have no words to describe the feeling and adrenalin rush this movie gave me.. i've never been so heart throbbed over a single movie.. i love this movie.. go see it.. right now.. stop what your doing.. get up.. go to your blockbuster/DVD provider and buy/rent it.. because by the time you read this it will have already been to late to see it in theaters.. go SEE It!!

title: awesome!!
review: Well, you know when sequels usually aren't nothing like the first one? This one proves that old saying wrong. Saw 2 was WAAAAY better than the first one. There are more characters involved making it constant 'edge of your seat' frenzy. Of course, just the characters isn't what makes it so interesting, it's where they are and what they got to go through. Yes, there is a lot of blood and gore but I can promise you that you will be so into the movie that you won't want to go to the bathroom or to the concessions while it's on. When you see the ending, you'll flash back through the movie and realize how things happened for it to end up that way making it more enjoyable when it's over. You won't leave thinking 'what?' you should be satisfied with this movie and know there will more than likely be a part 3.

title: Predictable, but also not?!?
review: I just saw this film and I must say "woah"! I cringed, squinted, and said "ohh ugh" more than I did watching the first. The sad thing is that I had the entire ending predicted a week before the movie came out. It is really quite like a game, if you think about it. All I did was try to figure out just why the character Amanda would return and why would she be forced to "play" again?!? Think about it. A little less than halfway through it I also pretty much figured out the common bond between the captives and where to find the combination. But I would have never thought the film would have ended where it did and even though I new the circumstances of why it all happened, it tied everything together very cleverly. All I am saying is that if you are one who can easily predict the outcome of films, even ones so cleverly written as the "Saw" films, then maybe pay a matinÃ©e admission to see it. BUT DO Definitely SEE THIS FILM! I think it is better and more clever than the first. It is more gruesome than the first, but the brutality is clever! Let's shoot for a hat trick!

title: Decent Sequel...entertaining movie
review:
After seeing the first Saw and hearing just a few days after about the upcoming sequel, I was immediately excited at the thought of a new installment. Bottom line- I am NOT disappointed.

In terms of quality- the movie is just average...but then again, when watching Saw, is the quality of acting so important as long as it does not distract you from the movie itself? Also some plot holes...but whatever.

I thought the movie was sweet. My seven dollars was well spent, and the twist (4 for that matter) were straight redonkulous. If you're looking for an entertaining, thrilling movie and not so analytical towards movies, go see Saw 2. But remember, there will be blood. :-) P.S. If you saw Saw 1, get your ass off the computer and go see the sequel with a few buddies with a strong stomach.

title: Good movie You gotta see both!
review: If you've seen the first one you'll like this one. This one is better than the first in my opinion. This movie although being about killing and torturing actually teaches you lessons. Just pay attention and you'll know about it. The movie is great if you have seen the first this one will add more I suggest you watching Saw I then Saw II so it will be easier for you to understand. I just got home from seeing it and it leaves you thinking. The director sure has a creative mind in making this movie. If anyone dislikes the movie because of the violence then don't reply on this. Go join another group or something.Well minimum is 10 lines so i am just gonna keep writing. See both movies they're really good it leaves at the edge of your seat the whole time. I liked it so there.

title: Some slight errors, but overall a good movie
review:
I think it was an actually pretty good movie, another plot twist, pending that my definition of plot twist pasts with the past arguments about the original Saw, but again I left the audience asking myself, "What in the hell..." Some things you don't see coming, some things you do. You'd have to go see it, I'm not spoiling it for you.

The whole timed death thing is kinda weird to me though, with the poison and all. Everyone's immune system is different. You can't have it exactly timed to 2 hours. What if a huge fat guy has twice as many white blood cells as someone else and outlives the 2 hours. Oh well, I John could have done his research on their blood samples? Go see it, well worth the $6.50.
